intro: Centaurea fuscata, commonly known as the brown centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to brown, with bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Centaurea fuscata is often used in traditional medicine and is also a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
